title: Changes of split buses in time

posts.content:
Is there an overview here anywhere of changes in split buses from 1949 till 1967?
What I mean is in the course of time, for example:
- Barndoor till March 1955
- March 1955 - Aug. 1958: ribbed bumper bus
- From Dec. 1960: hinges from swing doors lower
- From Aug. 1962: wider rear hatch
Etc.

There is a book, I have it somewhere. Dave Eccles I think was the author. Can't remember the name of the book though. However it is missing some details, nor much though.

My 55 has a few one year only things I didn't realise they had and nor did Dave

That sounds interesting!
I have something similar: VOLKSWAGEN bug! The people's car, by RAY MILLER.
But I hope there is an overview of major changes of split buses, just to start with.

The original vw bus by Laurence Meredith is pretty good. It lists pretty much every production change by chassis number in the data section. Pretty old now so not sure if there's anything better out there J

http://www.amazon.co.uk/VW-Transporter- ... bc?ie=UTF8

original version created while editor of the SSVCâ€¦more detailed version available now
all and everything you would ever want to need to know

Thank you for all the books with a lot of details, interesting for a study.
What I'm looking for now is to recognize the differences in years/models by (optical) changes.
So changes in the rear hatches, lights, hinges, door handles, bumpers etc. and the years the changed were made.
Thanks in advance.

Oh Dear....
Sounds as if you are on a downward slope....
You will end up as sad as all the other old giffers on here..
Ah yes...Innies v outies
Shallow dog leg v deep dog leg
Rising sun division
Finger recess in rear hatch...
Lip on the rear whhel arch.....
etc. etc.

You could take the opposite approach like Einstein when asked for his telephone number...." I have no idea - but I know where to look!"

Sadly I may have graduated to one of the former categories..
I can spot a wrong un from miles away..

type21f wrote:..
I can spot a wrong un from miles away..


Takes one to know one...

I am just an autistic person (no joke) who wants to distinguish the different types.
Am I hopelessly lost here?

Beste EeveeWee,

i'll bring you my specification guide when i'm in the Diemen bos met de hond. Let me know if I can leave it with your parents if you are not there.

monkey wrote:

I can spot a wrong un from miles away..


Takes one to know one...



Indeed especially when they advertise on here..
LOL

That is what is great about this Forum...Help others...Pass it forwards..
I try to help...
Sometimes I hinder..
Hopefully most of the time..I help!
G
